benchmark_details.name: Argument Summarisation and Evaluation (ASE)
benchmark_details.overview: The ASE dataset captures the end-to-end process of preparing an argumentative essay for a debate, covering tasks of claim and evidence identification, evidence convincingness ranking, argumentative essay summarisation, and quality evaluation based on human feedback.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive dataset for evaluating end-to-end argument mining and summarisation systems.

data.source: Collected from various open-source sources, encompassing 31 debate topics.
data.annotation: Annotated by human experts using the Amazon Mechanical Turk platform.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated using standard evaluation techniques for argument mining tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better alignment with human preferences and argument quality.
methodology.validation: Performance evaluated using human assessments and established automated metrics.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants were informed about the task and could exit at any time.
